description: a: hand held eggbeater with two beaters attached to turn handle; red handles; b: stand with black base and clear top portion
dimension: 12 x 5 1/2 x 4 3/4 in. (30.48 x 13.97 x 12.07 cm) (eggbeater in stand)
text: Dover was the best-known name in eggbeaters, but the Maynard model was the epitome of advanced technology and engineering. It is a compendium of mechanical engineering, with a canted handle (ergonomic before its time), a rubberized covering over the gears (with pin holes for periodic oiling) and silent rotating gears. It is a miniature turbine, fully functional and symbolic emblem of the machine age. As marriages of convenience go, the designer-manufacturer union produced extraordinary offspring.
title: Eggbeater with stand
